modules.description: This module provides operations for constructing, modifying, and querying ordered key-value maps, with a focus on structured data manipulation. It works with maps where keys are of type `colorable_bar_part`, enabling efficient iteration, transformation, and conversion between maps and sequences. Use cases include managing configuration data or hierarchical structures requiring ordered access and predicate-based filtering.

manages ordered key-value maps with `colorable_bar_part` keys, supporting efficient iteration, transformation, and conversion between maps and sequences. It enables structured data manipulation through construction, modification, and querying operations. Users can filter data using predicates, convert maps to sequences, and manage hierarchical or configuration data. For example, it allows building a map of colored bar segments and extracting only those with a specific attribute.

The module offers pretty-printing utilities for event types like workspace changes, window interactions, and key binding updates, operating on structured data such as records that encapsulate event-specific details. It works with custom types representing system or user-triggered actions, including bar configurations and shutdown reasons, tailored for a tiling window manager. Use cases include debugging event flows, logging user interactions, and monitoring dynamic configuration changes in real-time.

Sends and receives JSON-encoded messages over a Unix socket to interact with i3, executes commands like moving windows or reloading configurations, and parses event streams for real-time updates. Works with socket connections, JSON data, and event subscriptions. Used to automate window management tasks and monitor workspace changes dynamically.

manages structured data through ordered key-value maps with specialized keys, enabling efficient manipulation and transformation of hierarchical configurations, while providing pretty-printing for event types to facilitate debugging and real-time monitoring of window manager activities. It supports operations like filtering, conversion to sequences, and custom formatting of events such as workspace changes and window interactions. Users can construct and query maps of colored bar segments or log detailed event records. Examples include extracting specific bar parts based on attributes or generating human-readable logs of system events.
